Reason: The enablePngCrush configuration option is performance-sensitive because it directly impacts the image processing performance of the dconverter software. Enabling PngCrush can significantly reduce the size of PNG images, leading to faster loading times and reduced memory consumption. On the other hand, disabling PngCrush can result in larger image sizes, slower loading times, and increased memory usage. Therefore, changes in the enablePngCrush configuration can have a notable effect on system performance.
